title: Ticket #939: Issue single status command for all cream jobs
description:
The cream api allows the client to query the status of all jobs. Condor should take advantage of this, rather than querying each job separately, as it currently does.

In a recent test run of 2000 jobs, the cream status command was executed 14284 times in 33 minutes.

Equivalent code for this already exists for several other job types in the gridmanager.

For Condor-C jobs, condorresource.cpp's CondorResource::DoScheddPoll implements this on a timer setup in the constructor.

Nordugrid jobs use nordugridresource.cpp's NordugridResource::DoJobStatus, again, set up in a timer in the constructor.

Can we factor out a shared implementation? 

virtual bool BaseResource::WantBulkStatusTimer()  { return false; }
virtual int BaseResource::BulkPobeInterval() { EXCEPT("Invalid call to BaseResource::BulkPobeInterval); }
virtual const char * BaseResource::ResourceName() { EXCEPT("Invalid call to BaseResource::ResourceName); }

BaseResource::BaseResource {
	...
	m_bulkPollTid = daemonCore->Register_Timer( 0,
	    (TimerHandlercpp)&BaseResource::DoBulkStatus,
	    "BaseResource::DoBulkStatus", (Service*)this );

	m_bulkStatusActive = false;
	...
}

int BaseResource::DoBulkStatus()
	if ( ( registeredJobs.IsEmpty() || resourceDown ) &&
		 m_bulkStatusActive == false ) {
			// No jobs or we can't talk to the schedd, so no point
			// in polling
		daemonCore->Reset_Timer( scheddPollTid, BulkPobeInterval() );
		return 0;
	}

	// TODO: Nordugrid jobs use a dedicated m_statusGahp?
	if ( gahp->isStarted() == false ) {
		if ( gahp->Startup() == false ) {
				// Failed to start the gahp server. Don't do anything
				// about it. The job objects will also fail on this call
				// and should go on hold as a result.
			daemonCore->Reset_Timer( m_bulkPollTid, BulkPobeInterval() );
			return 0;
		}
	}

	daemonCore->Reset_Timer( m_bulkPollTid, TIMER_NEVER );

	if(m_scheddStatusActive == false) {
		dprintf(D_FULLDEBUG, "Starting bulk job poll of %s\n", ResourceName());
		int r = StartBulkPoll();
		return r;
	} else {
		int r = FinishBulkPoll();
		if(r == TRUE) {
			dprintf(D_FULLDEBUG, "Finished bulk job poll of %s\n", ResourceName());
		}
		daemonCore->Reset_Timer( m_bulkPollTid, BulkPobeInterval() );
		return r;
	}
}
remarks:
2009-Nov-25 11:22:16 by adesmet:
Done.

100 jobs, each running 10 minutes, took 105 calls to CREAM_JOB_STATUS, down from 401. 1000 jobs, each running for 10 minutes made 1,130 calls, down from a predicted 3,000-4,000. Longer running jobs will have larger payoffs. In general, given N jobs running M minutes, the old system would generate about N*M/5 calls, the new one will generate about N+M/5.
